alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Nemaha; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 2:09AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Nemaha, southeastern Washington and Marshall Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 209 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Blue Springs to 3 miles southeast of Marysville to near Waterville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marysville, Seneca, Blue Rapids, Frankfort, Waterville, Centralia, Axtell, Beattie, Barnes, Summerfield, Vermillion, Oketo, Baileyville, Lillis and Bremen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
